sub_topic: Finding the chromatic index of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the graph G shown below:
    
  ![graph image](https://i.imgur.com/w4Jcevw.png)
  
What is the chromatic index of G?
message_2:
The chromatic index of a graph is the smallest number of colors needed to color its edges such that no two adjacent edges share the same color. In other words, it is the minimum number of colors required for a proper edge coloring.

For the given graph G, we can observe that it is a complete graph with 5 vertices, denoted as K_5. In a complete graph, every vertex is connected to every other vertex.

The chromatic index of a complete graph K_n with n vertices can be determined using the following rule:

1. If n is even, the chromatic index is n.
2. If n is odd, the chromatic index is n+1.

Since the given graph G is a complete graph with 5 vertices (odd number), its chromatic index is 5 + 1 = 6.
